text: Some lines stay with us longer than entire stories.
author: anonymous

text: I didn't mean to remember it. I just did.
author: from an old notebook

text: A book is sometimes only a place to hide a sentence.
author: anonymous

text: I read it once. It stayed.
author: from a book you loved

text: This was not the most important line. Just the one I kept.
author: from an old notebook

text: Some sentences feel like they were waiting for you.
author: anonymous

text: A good line doesn't ask to be shared. It asks to be kept.
author: anonymous

text: I don't remember the page. Only this.
author: from a book you loved

text: I folded the corner, not the thought.
author: anonymous

text: A sentence can be a small place to rest.
author: anonymous

text: There is a difference between reading and keeping.
author: anonymous

text: I closed the book and kept the line.
author: from a book you loved
